Articles.Content: I tried but it seemed buggy
How so?

Surpassed 15,600 downloads!

Oh my God! Thank you so much

I plan on redoing some models in the near future, as-well as added some new, community-contributed ones. Also, better credits in the descriptions are to appear with the next update, as well as a TweakScale config.
23k views. Neat!

Updated to 1.0.5.

Works fine!
Come on guys! Don't led the downloads drop!
I know, I know, the thread got messed up. Fixing that atm.
Do you plan on adding- similar to the HSH mod of yore- actual ship hulls, and say little modules so a ship takes 200 parts rather than 600?
I might, but I am not sure. The hollow parts seem quite complicated to model, as evidenced w/the tube and the dome.
Will re-do the dome in the near future. Might take a while, though!
Merry Christmas and a happy new year to everyone!
And to you as well
Does this work with tweakscale? I believe it does thanks to Space Scumbag, but I want conformation.
Yep! It does.
Nearing in on 20k downloads. Thanks to everyone for sharing this mod on social media and whatnot!
The mod doesnt work for me is there anything unusual about the installation?

hey,

I wanted to download the mod, but I cannot get to KerbalStuff.

does anyone know why this is, +is there another download?

Hi, sorry for the inconvenience. I will migrate the download shortly.

@Noellen no, installation is simply moving the folder into GameData, like any other mod. Make sure you're using KSP 1.0 or later.
Uploaded to Curse and waiting moderator approval. Hang tight.
Download is ready. Have fun.

Posted SpaceDock download to replace KerbalStuff.

If you have any installation questions, please PM me, and I will answer them. It's as simple as dragging a folder into GameData!

@2001kraft Can you please add the original license from Nazari1382 into the download and in the OP, that would be greatly appriciated.

Also it is confusing which license it really is because on KerbalStuff you had the GPL license, on SpaceDock you now have CC-BY license and on Curse you have the "All Rights Reserved" license - so we don't know which is the correct license now. I also couldn't find any license in the old downloads from Nazari1382.
Licenses have always been confusing for me, so thanks for letting me know. I'll sort it out ASAP.
Licenses have been updated to Creative Commons (CC) 3.0.
